eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Manage health points including a protective shield and armor. Health can be assigned to players, enemies, NPCs, or even inanimate objects such as breaking doors and mining rocks.

Damage calculations are performed in this order:

Incoming Damage -> Is Damage Cooldown active? -> Chance to Dodge -> Flat Damage Reduction -> Percent Damage Reduction -> Damage to Shield -> Damage to Health

How to use:

- Set desired values in behavior properties
- To apply damage use “Apply damage to an object”
- To heal health, use “Heal object” action
- To activate the shield, use “Activate shield” action
- Health and shield regeneration will happen automatically based on properties
 
Tips:

- While damage cooldown is active, no damage will be applied to health or shield (the object is invincible)
- Try using the “Blink” extension while damage cooldown is active
- Use the “Is just damaged” or "Is just healed" conditions to trigger sound and visual effects

Health properties:

- Starting health points
- Maximum health points. Use "0" for no maximum
- Damage cooldown (seconds) Use "0" for no cooldown
- Rate of health regeneration (points per second)
- Delay before health regeneration starts after being hit (seconds)
- Allow heals to increase health above max health (regen will never exceed max health)

Shield properties:

- Max shield points. Use "0" for no maximum
- Duration of shield (seconds) Use "0" to make shield permanent
- Rate of shield regeneration (points per second)
- Delay before shield regeneration starts after being hit (seconds)
- Block excess damage when shield is broken (yes/no)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Health
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Manage health points and damage, including a protective shield and armor.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Manage health (life) points including a protective shield and armor.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Health

eventsFunctions.description: Apply damage to the object. Shield and armor can reduce this damage if enabled.
eventsFunctions.name: Hit
eventsFunctions.sentence: Apply _PARAM2_ points of damage to _PARAM0_ (Damage can be reduced by Shield: _PARAM3_, Armor: _PARAM4_)

events.comment: Only consider incoming damage when damage cooldown is not active
No damage will be applied when dodged
If shield is active, damage the shield first
If damage is less than shield, subtract damage from shield.
If damage is greater than shield, conditionally apply excess damage based on property
Apply excess damage only if shield does not block excess damage

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/), D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Draws a draggable slider that users can move to select a numerical value.
The value range, tick spacing, and the appearance of the slider can be defined with properties.

How to use:
- Add this behavior a **Shape Painter** object
- Place an instance of that shape painter on the screen where you want the slider to appear
- Use the "Value" expression to find the Value based on the position of the slider

Tips:
- You can disable the slider to prevent a user from interacting with it
- You can set the Value of the slider and the slider will move to the correct position

Further details can be found in [this tutorial video](https://youtu.be/iiTUwdAT_hs).

Breaking changes (1.0.0)
- Track thickness and length properties replaced track width and height. These 2 properties must be set again if they were different from the default size.
- Hidden sliders can be dragged. The "enable" action must be used to disable them.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DraggableSliderControl
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A draggable slider that users can move to select a numerical value.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Let users select a numerical value by dragging a slider.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: DraggableSliderControl

Set active track parameters (by default, use thumb color)
Draw active track (2 pixels bigger than property)
Draw half circle at end of track (active side)
Prepare halo
Draw halo (it will grow or shrink as needed)
Use a more opaque halo while being dragged (it will grow or shrink as needed)
Prepare thumb settings
Draw Circle thumb
Draw Rectangle thumb

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @e1e5en
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Detect swipe gestures based on their distance and duration.

Use the "Detect swipe gestures" action once at the beginning of your scene.

Expressions:
- `StartPointX`, `StartPointY`: Coordinates of the point where the swipe starts
- `EndPointX`, `EndPointY`: Coordinates of the swipe end point
- `Distance`: Length of the swipe, in pixels
- `DistanceX`, `DistanceY`: Distance the swipe moved in each axis
- `Angle`: Direction the swipe moved towards. Range (-180, 180)

Conditions:

- `Is swipe in progress?` - A swipe starts when the mouse click or touch begins
- `Is swipe valid?` - A swipe is valid if it passes the distances and duration restrictions
- `Has swipe just ended?` - When the mouse or touch is released, this condition is true for one frame 
- `Was last swipe valid?` - The state of the previous swipe is saved until the next swipe begins.
- `Swipe moved in a direction (4-way movement)` - the direction value for 4 sides (UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT). In this case, the “circle” is divided into 4 segments of 90 degrees
- `Swipe moved in a direction (8-way movement)` - the direction value for 8 sides (UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, UP-LEFT, UP-RIGHT, DOWN-LEFT, DOWN-RIGHT). In this case, the “circle” is divided into 8 segments of 45 degrees.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SwipeGesture
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Detect swipe gestures based on their distance and duration

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension can be useful for:
* Stick an accessory to a moving object,
* Animate a skeleton.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Sticker
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Behavior to stick objects to other objects - so that they follow the position and rotation of the object they are stuck to.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Stick the object to another. Use the action to stick the object, or unstick it later.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Sticker

eventsFunctions.description: Stick on another object.
eventsFunctions.name: Stick
